pr_title: Refactor importer to handle token transfers in crypto transfer

timeline.message:
Refactor importer to handle token transfers in crypto transfer

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Rework token transfer handling

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Change transactions.js query for token transfers, and fix tests

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Revert entity listener token test to only validate tokens

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Add migration to delete token transfers transaction type

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Update docs first draft

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Rework rest integration tests to be closer to original intent

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

Add a comment to record item listener

Signed-off-by: Ian Jungmann <ian.jungmann@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText:
We implemented a convention a few sprints back of using a new minor version on new sprints.
So this should be V1.31.1 - just like my PR :)
We'll see whoever gets in first.
The other person just has to update their version, due to flyway checksum since we can't skip versions.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Renamed to V1.31.3 after you and Xin got yours in.
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.author: Nana-EC
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -295,7 +295,6 @@ const addTokenTransferTransaction = async (tokenTransfer) => {
     {account: tokenTransfer.treasuryAccountId, amount: NETWORK_FEE},

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I agree, my first go was basically to minimally affect the tests, but to be fully accurate with the new logic they should be together.  I'll do some refactoring to make that happen.
replies.author: ijungmann

replies.bodyText: I've reworked the setup a fair amount, effectively the addCryptoTransaction already allowed one to add token information, so I ripped out all of the tokenTransfers logic, changed the tests around to make the tokenTransfers merge into the cryptoTransfers, and then reworked the addCryptoTransfer logic to default a couple things that weren't being specified in the tokenTransfers (alternatively, I could just force the tests to have recipientIds and amounts specified).
replies.author: ijungmann

timeline.author: Nana-EC
timeline.diffHunk:

        LEFT OUTER JOIN t_transaction_types ttt ON ttt.proto_id = t.type
        JOIN crypto_transfer ctl ON tlist.consensus_timestamp = ctl.consensus_timestamp
        LEFT OUTER JOIN token_transfer ttl
-         ON t.type = 30
+         ON t.type = 14

replies.bodyText: Took it one step further and used the const transactionTypes in constants.js since it was already being pulled in.
